triples.name: Helicopter
triples.relevance: Helicopters are explicitly mentioned as a primary aerial platform type for robotic manipulation systems.

triples.name: Multirotor
triples.relevance: Multirotors are specifically cited as conventional underactuated platforms used for aerial robotic manipulation.

triples.name: Robotic arm
triples.relevance: Robotic manipulators mounted on aerial platforms are the core focus of the survey.

triples.name: Teleoperation
triples.relevance: Teleoperation is explicitly mentioned as a key development area in aerial robotic manipulation systems.

triples.name: Computer vision
triples.relevance: Perception capabilities are central to enabling aerial robots to understand and interact with their environment.

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: Planning is explicitly identified as a key development area for autonomous aerial robotic manipulation.

triples.name: Unmanned aerial vehicle
triples.relevance: UAVs are the foundational platform technology for modern aerial robotic manipulation systems.
